intro: Bulbophyllum lobbii var. breviflorum, commonly known as the short-flowered Bulbophyllum, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, clustered blooms in shades of white and yellow, often with a subtle fragrance. Its pseudobulbs are cylindrical and covered in a layer of brownish bark-like tissue. This variety is appreciated by orchid enthusiasts for its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
